msgId.title: Message ID
msgId.description: Message identification for binding request with response.

timeout.title: Request timeout
timeout.description: Timeout to wait for IQRF DPA response.

pNum.title: Peripheral number
pNum.description: Integer that corresponds to the respective peripheral.

backupIndex.title: Backup block index
backupIndex.description: Index of the block of backup data to start reading from. The last byte of read data specifies number of remaining data blocks to read.

items.title: Data block
items.description: One block of coordinator network info data.

pCmd.title: Peripheral command
pCmd.description: Integer that corresponds to the respective peripheral command.

pData.title: Request packet data
pData.description: Binary buffer with DPA request data.

items.title: Data byte
items.description: Single packet data byte.

returnVerbose.title: Verbose response
returnVerbose.description: Flag that includes additional parameters in the response.

selectedNodes.title: Array of nodes
selectedNodes.description: Array of integer values corresponding to the selected node addresses. Use default value to select all nodes and use sleepAfterFrc parameter.

items.title: Node address
items.description: Address of node device in network.

pCmd.title: Peripheral command response
pCmd.description: Integer that corresponds to the respective peripheral command response.

pData.title: Response packet data
pData.description: Binary buffer with DPA response data.

items.title: Data byte
items.description: Single packet data byte.

statusStr.title: Status string
statusStr.description: IQRF GW daemon API (general or mType) status in string form.

raw.title: Raw DPA messages
raw.description: Returns array of objects req-cnf-rsp, see its description.

items.title: Raw DPA messages object
items.description: Object containing Request, Confirmation and Response DPA messages and their timestamps.

control.title: Bonding control
control.description: Enables remote bonding mode. If enabled then previously bonded nodes are forgotten.

userData.title: User data
userData.description: Optional data passed to the bonded node.

items.title: Data byte
items.description: Byte of optional user data

items.title: Node address
items.description: Node device network address

bondingMask.title: Bonding mask
bondingMask.description: Bonding mask. See IQRF OS User's and Reference guides (remote bonding, function bondNewNode). For DPA < 4.00.

bondingTestRetries.title: Bonding test retries
bondingTestRetries.description: Maximum number of FRCs to test whether the node was successfully bonded. For DPA >= 4.00.

nAdr.title: Node address.
nAdr.description: Address of node device in network.

per.title: Peripheral number
per.description: Peripheral number to get information about.

par.title: Peripheral information
par.description: Optional peripheral specific information. See DPA framework technical guide for details.

perT.title: Peripheral type
perT.description: Peripheral type number, see DPA framework technical guide for peripheral type constants. If peripheral is not supported or enabled, the value is PERIPHERAL_TYPE_DUMMY (0).

rssi.title: RSSI
rssi.description: Gets the RF signal level. See lastRSSI at IQRF OS Reference Guide.

supplyVoltage.title: Supply voltage.
supplyVoltage.description: Module supply voltage, contains real voltage value.

osFlags.title: OS flags
osFlags.description: Bit 0: 1 = insufficient OS build for the used DPA version; Bit 1: Supported interface - 0 = SPI / 1 = UART; Bit 2: 1 = Custom DPA Handler detected; Bit 3: 1 = Custom DPA Handler not detected, but enabled in TR config; Bit 4: No interface supported; Bit 5: IQRF OS changed from factory state; Bit 6-7: reserved.

slotLimits.title: Time slot limits
slotLimits.description: Lower nibble contains shortest timeslot length in 10 ms units. Upper nibble contains longest timeslot length.

dpaVer.title: DPA version
dpaVer.description: DPA version represented by an integer value.

userPerNr.title: User peripherals count
userPerNr.description: Number of all non-embedded peripherals implemented by Custom DPA Handler.

embeddedPers.title: Embedded peripherals
embeddedPers.description: Array of embedded peripheral type numbers.

items.title: Peripheral number
items.description: Embedded peripheral type number.

hwpidVer.title: HWPID version
hwpidVer.description: Hardware profile version represented by an integer value.

userPer.title: User peripherals
userPer.description: Array of implemented non-embedded user peripherals.

items.title: User peripheral number
items.description: Peripheral type number of non-embedded user peripheral.

items.title: IBK byte.
items.description: Individual bonding key byte.

rxFilter.title: RX filter
rxFilter.description: RX signal filter (0-64) to be passed as a parameter to checkRF IQRF OS function. Set value to 255 to get data from previous measurement.

checksum.title: Checksum
checksum.description: Checksum of the Configuration part. XORed with all configuration bytes results in value 0x5F.

configuration.title: Configuration array
configuration.description: Content the configuration memory block from address 0x01 to 0x1F.

items.title: Configuration byte
items.description: Single byte of TR configuration block

rfpgm.title: RFPGM configuration.
rfpgm.description: See parameter of setupRFPGM IQRF OS function.

readTimeout.title: Read timeout
readTimeout.description: Timeout in 10ms unit to wait for data to be read after data is written. Set to 255 to read no data.

writtenData.title: Data to write
writtenData.description: Data to be written to TX buffer.

items.title: Data byte
items.description: Byte of data to be written to TX buffer.

readData.title: Data read
readData.description: Data read from the RX buffer.

items.title: Data byte
items.description: Data byte read from the RX buffer.

mask.title: Pin mask
mask.description: Masks pins of the port, allowing for filtering which pins are set.

items.title: Node address
items.description: Address of node device in network.

status.title: FRC status
status.description: Return code of Send FRC operation. Equal to number of responding nodes, or an error code if the value is >= 240. See IQRF OS documentation for details.

repeat.title: DPA request repeat
repeat.description: Maximum number of DPA request retries in case of a failure.

items.title: Standard
items.description: Implemented standard peripheral.

supplyVoltage.title: Supply voltage
supplyVoltage.description: Supply voltage in a string representation.

mid.title: MID string
mid.description: Module ID in a hexadecimal string representation.

version.title: OS version string
version.description: OS version in a string representation.

build.title: OS build
build.description: OS build in a string representation.

trMcuType.title: TR/MCU type
trMcuType.description: Object containing information about transciever and mcu type.

trType.title: TR MCU type
trType.description: Transciever type in a string representation.

mcuType.title: MCU type
mcuType.description: MCU type in a string representation.

fccCertified.title: FCC certification
fccCertified.description: Indicates whether device is FCC certified.

flags.title: OS flags
flags.description: Object containing OS flags in a human readable from.

insufficientOsBuild.title: Insufficient OS build
insufficientOsBuild.description: Indicates whether the OS build is insufficient for the used DPA version.

interfaceType.title: Supported interface
interfaceType.description: Specifies interface supported by the uploaded DPA plugin.

dpaHandlerDetected.title: DPA handler detected
dpaHandlerDetected.description: Indicates that a Custom DPA Handler has been uploaded to the device.

dpaHandlerNotDetectedButEnabled.title: Missing DPA handler
dpaHandlerNotDetectedButEnabled.description: Indicates that a Custom DPA Handler hasn't been detected, but is enabled in TR configuration.

noInterfaceSupported.title: No interface supported
noInterfaceSupported.description: Indicates that no interface is supported by the uploaded DPA plugin.

iqrfOsChanged.title: IQRF OS changed
iqrfOsChanged.description: Indicates whether IQRF OS has changed from factory configuration.

frcAggregationEnabled.title: FRC aggregation
frcAggregationEnabled.description: Indicates whether FRC aggregation is enabled.

dpaVer.title: DPA version
dpaVer.description: DPA version in a string representation.

enumFlags.title: Device enumeration flags
enumFlags.description: Object containing device operation mode flags.

stdAndLpNetwork.title: STD+LP network
stdAndLpNetwork.description: STD+LP network is running, otherwise STD network.

embPers.title: Embedded peripherals
embPers.description: Object containing state of embedded peripherals.

values.title: Embedded peripherals bit array.
values.description: Each bit enables/disables one of the embedded 32 predefined peripherals.

items.title: Embedded peripherals byte.
items.description: Byte of embedded peripherals information.

coordinator.title: Coordinator enabled
coordinator.description: Indicates whether coordinator peripheral is enabled.

node.title: Node enabled
node.description: Indicates whether node peripheral is enabled.

os.title: OS peripheral
os.description: Indicates whether OS peripheral is enabled.

eeprom.title: EEPROM peripheral
eeprom.description: Indicates whether EEPROM peripheral is enabled.

eeeprom.title: EEEPROM peripheral
eeeprom.description: Indicates whether EEEPROM peripheral is enabled.

ram.title: RAM peripheral
ram.description: Indicates whether RAM peripheral is enabled.

ledr.title: LEDR peripheral
ledr.description: Indicates whether LEDR peripheral is enabled.

ledg.title: LEDG peripheral
ledg.description: Indicates whether LEDG peripheral is enabled.

spi.title: SPI peripheral
spi.description: Indicates whether SPI peripheral is enabled.

io.title: IO peripheral
io.description: Indicates whether IO peripheral is enabled.

thermometer.title: Thermometer peripheral
thermometer.description: Indicates whether thermometer peripheral is enabled.

pwm.title: PWN peripheral
pwm.description: Indicates whether PWM peripheral is enabled.

uart.title: UART peripheral
uart.description: Indicates whether UART peripheral is enabled.

frc.title: FRC peripheral
frc.description: Indicates whether FRC peripheral is enabled.

rfChannelA.title: RF channel A
rfChannelA.description: Main RF channel A. Valid numbers depend on used RF band.

rfChannelB.title: RF channel B
rfChannelB.description: Main RF channel B. Used at RFPGM only. Valid numbers depend on used RF band.

rfSubChannelA.title: RF subchannel A
rfSubChannelA.description: Main RF channel A of subordinate network for when a node plays the role of coordinator. Valid numbers depend on used RF band. Only valid for DPA < 4.00.

rfSubChannelB.title: RF subchannel B
rfSubChannelB.description: Main RF channel B of subordinate network for when a node plays the role of coordinator. Valid numbers depend on used RF band. Only valid for DPA < 4.00.

lpRxTimeout.title: LP-RX timeout
lpRxTimeout.description: Timeout for receiving RF packets at device in LP mode. Unit in cycles (46ms in LP-RX mode).

rfAltDsmChannel.title: Alternative DSM channel
rfAltDsmChannel.description: Nonzero value specifies an alternative DPA service mode channel.

localFrcReception.title: Local FRC reception
localFrcReception.description: If set to true, Local FRC reception is enabled at node device.

rfPgmEnableAfterReset.title: RFPGM enable after reset.
rfPgmEnableAfterReset.description: Enable RFPGM mode by invoking TR module reset.

rfPgmTerminateAfter1Min.title: Timed RFPGM termination
rfPgmTerminateAfter1Min.description: If set to true, RPFGM mode is automatically terminated after 1 minute.

rfPgmTerminateMcuPin.title: RPFGM termination by pin
rfPgmTerminateMcuPin.description: If set to true, RPFGM is terminated by a dedicated pin of the TR module.

rfPgmDualChannel.title: RFPGM dual channel
rfPgmDualChannel.description: If set to true, dual channel function is enabled, otherwise single channel function is utilized.

rfPgmLpMode.title: RPFGM LP mode
rfPgmLpMode.description: If set to true, LP-RX mode is used during RFPGM, otherwise, STD-RX mode is used.

rfPgmIncorrectUpload.title: Last RFPGM state
rfPgmIncorrectUpload.description: Read-only property. Indicates whether the last RPFGM mode has been successfully completed.

customDpaHandler.title: Enable Custom DPA Handler
customDpaHandler.description: If set to true, a Custom DPA Handler is called when an event occurs.

dpaPeerToPeer.title: DPA P2P
dpaPeerToPeer.description: If set to true, then DPA Peer-to-Peer is enabled at node device.

nodeDpaInterface.title: Node interface control
nodeDpaInterface.description: If set to true, then node device can be controlled using SPI or UART interface. Only valid for DPA < 4.00.

uartBaudRate.title: UART baud rate
uartBaudRate.description: Baud rate of the UART interface if it is used.

dpaAutoexec.title: DPA autoexec
dpaAutoexec.description: If set to true, DPA Autoexec is executed at a later stage of the module boot time.

routingOff.title: Disable routing
routingOff.description: If set to true, the node device does not route packets in the network.

ioSetup.title: IO setup
ioSetup.description: If set to true, DPA IO Setup is executed at an early stage of the module boot time.

peerToPeer.title: Peer-to-Peer
peerToPeer.description: If set to true, device receives non-networking peer-to-peer packets and raises peer-to-peer events.

neverSleep.title: Never sleep
neverSleep.description: If set to true, node unbonded using IQRF buttons never sleeps during button bonding. Only valid for DPA >= 3.03.

stdAndLpNetwork.title: STD+LP network
stdAndLpNetwork.description: If set to true, coordinator device controls STD+LP network, otherwise it controls STD network. Setting is only changed if there are no nodes in the network. Only valid for DPA >= 4.00.

index.title: Device index
index.description: Zero based index of the device to set.

time.title: ON timer
time.description: Time in seconds. Allowed values are <1;127> or 60*<1;127>.

commands.title: Array of DALI commands
commands.description: Array of 2 bytes (16 bits) wide values, each representing one DALI command at the standard DALI format YAAAAAAS+DDDDDDDD.

items.title: DALI command
items.description: 16bit DALI command value

status.title: DALI status
status.description: DALI command status: See IQRF DALI standard for details.

value.title: DALI value
value.description: DALI command value: See IQRF DALI standard for details.

prevVals.title: Previous power
prevVals.description: Array integers corresponding to the previous power level of each selected light. If the unimplemented light was selected the returned value is 0.

items.title: Light power
items.description: Power of a selected light

clientId.title: Client ID
clientId.description: Client identifier associated with a subset of scheduler tasks.

task.title: Scheduler task(s)
task.description: Scheduler task object or array of scheduler task objects.

messaging.title: Messaging
messaging.description: Messaging service identifier(s), used to determine which service shall send messages.

items.title: Seconds field
items.description: 5 = 5 seconds past minute, * = every second, */5 = every 5 seconds.

items.title: Minutes field
items.description: 5 = 5 minutes past hour, * = every minute, */5 = every 5 minutes.

items.title: Hours field
items.description: 5 = at 5 AM, * = every hour, */5 = every 5 hours.

items.title: Days of month field
items.description: 5 = 5th day of the month, * = every day, */5 = every 5 days.

items.title: Months field
items.description: 5 = 5th month of the year, * = every month, */5 = every 5 months.

items.title: Day of the week field
items.description: 5 = only on Friday, * = every week day, */5 = every 5 days a week; 0 sunday, 1 - monday, 6 - saturday.

items.title: Years field
items.description: 2025 = only in year 2025, * = every year, */5 = every 5 years; 1970+.

exactTime.title: Oneshot task
exactTime.description: Schedule task to execute once at a specific time.

startTime.title: Scheduled time
startTime.description: Scheduled execution time for oneshot task.

periodic.title: Periodic task
periodic.description: Schedule task to be executed periodically.

period.title: Task period
period.description: Period to wait between executing a task.

persist.title: Task persistence.
persist.description: If set to true, task will persist through Daemon restart.
